bioghist.p: Charles E. Gilbert (b. 1927) was a professor of political science at Swarthmore College from 1954 to 1989, and was the College's first provost, a role he filled from 1969 to 1974. The Provost is the chief academic officer of the College, overseeing the curriculum and the faculty. Gilbert also served as the chairman of Swarthmore's Commission on Educational Policy in 1966-1967.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records from the office of Provost Charles Gilbert. The collection also includes papers of Dean Susan Cobb and Associate Development Officer Richard Schrader. Materials include: grant proposals and reports; minutes and memoranda of the Council on Educational Policy and other faculty committees; correspondence on staffing and academics in various college departments; reports, notes, and memoranda from various student organizations; information on admissions policies and funding for minority students; and topical files related to Swarthmore's interaction with other higher education institutions, including Haverford College and Bryn Mawr College. The collection also includes materials on the faculty and student responses to the Vietnam War and national politics, including discussions of a position statement among the faculty and a proposed two week recess of classes before the November elections.
